newsitem.title: USA: Pioneer Financial Q4 met expectations.
newsitem.headline: Pioneer Financial Q4 met expectations.

text.p: Pioneer Financial Services Inc said Friday its 1996 earnings met the company's expectations and have put it in a positive position for its planned merger with Conseco Inc.

"Our earnings were consistent with our expectations," said chairman Peter Nauert. "We achieved significant increases in pre-tax operating income in our life insurance and senior health divisions. In addition, sales in our group medical division increased in the fourth quarter as we released new products."
Pioneer Financial, a national health and life insurer, posted diluted per-share earnings of $0.70 for the fourth quarter, up from $0.59 a year ago, and $2.16, up from $1.85, for the year.
"Our strong earnings results for 1996 and the continued expansion of our distribution systems place us in a very positive position for our planned merger with Conseco," Nauert said in a statement.
As previously reported, Conseco will acquire Pioneer Financial through an exchange of stock. Completion of the transaction is expected in late April.
